channel.title: Debian Short Term Support (STS) Proposal - similar Debian Rolling / CUT (Constantly Usable Testing)
channel.description:
An interesting proposal by a Debian dev is to have something that is stable, but based off of a more fresh code branch than the usual, supported by sponsors who would appreciate that kind of thing. Let's keep an eye on it if it ever takes off.
https://noah.meyerhans.us/2020/10/27/debian-sts-short-term-support/

item.title: Debian Short Term Support (STS) Proposal - similar Debian Rolling / CUT (Constantly Usable Testing)
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Similar Debian rolling proposal.

Might be really good if this materializes.

lwn.net

Debian rolling proposal gathers steam [LWN.net]

The Debian project is again seriously discussing proposals to add a user-centric, frequently-updated distribution product to its public offerings. The concept centers around providing a rolling release with a continuous (and therefore current)...

Or Debian CUT (Constantly Usable Testing).

https://cut.debian.net/

Read full topic
item.source: Debian Short Term Support (STS) Proposal - similar Debian Rolling / CUT (Constantly Usable Testing)
